meanings.sent1: Walking near cliffs without caution can lead to hazards.
meanings.sent2: Construction workers are trained to identify hazards on the job site.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought crossing the road was a hazard to its acorn hunt.
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, love can be a hazard that catches us off guard.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead were a clear hazard of an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Something that causes danger or risk
meanings.sent1: Chemical spills are environmental hazards that need immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The faulty wiring in the old building was a fire hazard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten was a hazard to the peaceful nap of the elderly cat.
meanings.sent4: Gossip can be a social hazard, spreading like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The icy road was a treacherous hazard for the inexperienced driver.

meanings.definition: To expose to danger or harm
meanings.sent1: Ignoring safety guidelines can hazard the lives of others.
meanings.sent2: The decision to hike alone in the wilderness hazarded his well-being.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy hazarded a leap off the high porch.
meanings.sent4: She hazarded her reputation by speaking out against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver hazarded the safety of everyone on the road.
